description: I opened a DICOMDIR containing a number of videos, but it doesn't seem to show them. It seems like it only shows the first image of some videos and there is no way to play them.

Every other damned app I've ever installed manages to navigate the file system including mounted optical drives. Total waste of time; I can't be bothered to copy the entire CD to my HD in order so have it fail in some other novel way.
summary: Won't open a mounted CD even following the sketchy instructions

description: The application did what I hoped it to do: I was able to view my MRI images and it even shows the series correctly. I didn't get into the more advanced features this time.
Opens images well and doesn't lag like most other apps.

sudo apt-get install -y aeskulap

you're welcom
At launch i get an error "system does not support OpenGL" which is absurd.

libGL error: No matching fbConfigs or visuals found
libGL error: failed to load driver: swrast

did i make any mistake?
the rest of functions are not jugable by me. 
(i have found a alternativ : weasis with a bash starter coming on a radiologic medium. )
summary: doesn't read my UTF8 files with umlaute

description: buen software para visualizar imágenes diagnósticas
summary: buen software para visualizar imágenes diagnósticas

description:
A powerful application for DICOM images
Easy to use, quick to launch and to access the images. 
The app creates a database to facilitate the access to the images.
The app has some interesting tools for co-registration of images (eg : MRI + PET). 
It has also some basic volume rendering tools, but it is not the scope of this app.
It has some useful tools for SEEG procedure (it seems to be designed for this use) it gives the coordinates of depth electrodes and shows the 3D rendering of depth electrodes.
summary: A very useful and powerful application for DICOM images

description: требует странных дополнительных разрешений, работать без них не хочет.
